title: Eating creepy-crawlies in St Davids: putting bug burgers on the menu in an Audi R8 Spyder
text:
Jeff the giant Madagascan hissing cockroach isn't on the menu at the Grub Kitchen in St Davids, west Wales. Neither is Georgina the green bean stick insect. But the UK's smallest city is the best place to order bug Bolognese followed by cricket cookies.

The country's first edible insect café is part of the Bug Farm, set up by Countryfile presenter Dr Sarah Beynon and her chef partner, Andy Holcroft. The rib-eye of Welsh black beef and politically correct "ploughperson's lunch" look mouthwatering, but curious diners are more interested in the insect offerings.

I'm sampling the grub (in the strict sense of the word) tasting board, complete with mealworm hummus and the bestselling bug burger – a...
description: Jeff the giant Madagascan hissing cockroach isn't on the menu at the Grub Kitchen in St Davids, west Wales.
